1.title: Whom shall you be?

choices: Ask the kid if he's following you
Continue walking and see if the kid follows
Leave him alone, he doesn't derserve any trouble
11.content:
"Hey Sirius, Remus, is it me for is that creepy kid with the greasy hair following us? Or is it my imagination?" you ask while eyeballing the stranger continue to follow you and your friends as you walk through the halls of Hogwarts. "If he's following us, that is really... weird..."

"He's a Slytherin," Remus said shakily, "lets go up the stairs and see if he still follows us."

Sirius huffed.

"Come on, Remus! No Slytherin is going to hurt us! I live with one...two..." he continued to mumble, "Well a lot of Slytherins and they're harmless. We should just go ask him."

You turn again to catch the green crest of Slytherin on his robes before he darted quickly to the side of the hallway. He stole a glance at you and wore a face of suspicion and contempt. You ran your hand through your hair.

"He's definately up to something..." you whisper.

"If we just go up to him of course he'll say he isn't following us! Sirius sometimes I swear your brain isn't working at all," Remus said.

"We'll scare him a little. You know, rattle him up, than he'll tell us."

Remus darted back, "A quieter approach would work much better... James what do you think?"

You flinch slightly. You weren't expecting to make a choice. You were much too busy watching that kid.

"Uh... James?" Sirius's voice sliced through your thoughts, "What are we going to do?"
11.title: The Kid with Greasy Hair

111.content:
"Well let's just ask him, I don't think there's any shame in that," you reply.

Sirius wore a winning grin as he playfully pinched Remus' arm. He jumped away, obviously quite upset. You made your way towards the boy. When he realized you were coming to began to back up, like an animal trapped in a corner.

"KID! Are you follo...." started Sirius with his fist out. You push him aside. Honestly, sometimes you couldn't understand what was up with him.

"Hello, my name is James Potter," you said as you extended your hand, "and this is Sirius Black and Remus Lupin."

The kid snarled and slapped your hand away as his eyes stayed on Sirius.

"I won't shake hands with you conspirators or the traitor."

"Conspirators?" Remus asked, interested.

"Traitor?" Sirius said accusingly.

"I know what you're up to...I know..." the boy hissed, "I'll catch you..."

"Let me assure you that we are up to nothing at all and we are not conspirating or traiting... is traiting even a word?" you say.

"Idiot, you can't even speak your own language," the boy laughed and threw a potion at your feet. A small explosion occured when the small vial made contact with the ground. An unsettling need to itch your legs took you.

"You rat! What is with you?" you scream.

You run after him and pin him to the ground.
111.title: The Talk

1111.content:
"Stop it!" rang a high pitched voice, "You're so cruel. Get off that poor boy, NOW!"

You couldn't believe your luck. You haven't even been at Hogwarts that long and you were already getting nailed. Reluctantly you get off your "victim" and bent down to relieve your itching legs.

The girl, Lily Evans, helped lift the boy to his feet and even helped him dust off the dust he collected while on the ground. Was she crazy? A grin spread across your face. At least she wasn't a prefect and wasn't going to take points away.

"James Potter, do you have some sort of reason for randomly attacking fellow students?" she questioned.

"He's a dirty rat, I'm telling you. He made some sort of potion to make my legs itch."

"I did not! The fool probably walked into some poison ivy!"

Lily's eyes glowed with anger.

"That is a mean lie to tell James. Next time I'm reporting you to our head."

"Go ahead Lily!"

"Fine!"

Lily walked away arm in arm with the boy. He turned back and flashed his vile grin.
1111.title: Meeting Lily

11111.content:
You could feel your face burn furiously. That boy certianly had some nerve to pull a stunt like that! and Lily! She strut around as if she was the hero. Just thinking about her made your blood boil.

The soft chuckling of your pal Remus reached your ears and irked your already hot temper.

"What?" you shout. You recieve no reply expect the crescendo of the laughter.

"Oh..." cried Remus through his laughter, "that didn't work out very well... not very well at all..."

You shrugged it off.

"I think I know him," mutter Sirius, lost in thought, "he came to a party my mother was throwing when I was younger."

"That's great Sirius," you answer, "but it won't be much use until you think of it AND I need to get back at them. My legs are itching like crazy!"

Remus shook his head in dismay, "Oh no, James is out for revenge... revenge... REVENGE!"

"I couldn't let something like that slip through my fingers," you smile cockily.
11111.title: Out for Revenge

choices: So, James wants to get back at Lily. Now he needs a plan.
111111.content: You know, once in a while, somethings happen. Things that decide the fate of the world, all because of a small decision, or the smallest oddities of chance. In this case, the simple fact that James Potter, normally a man well-known for his poor decisions, chose to venge himself on the cruel and thoughtless scolding of Lily Evans, instead of the act of self defense performed by a weak yet quick-witted boy named Severus Snape, changed the course of history for the better. And in so doing it improved the lives of James, Remus, Severus and Sirius, even allowing Severus to befriend these three, to make a true quartet of equals. In another world, they might have settled for a less loyal housemate, instead of inspiring a precocious young Slytherin to overcome his preconceptions long enough to bridge the divide between the rival houses.

12.content:
"Check this out Sirius!!" your oldest sister Bellatrix shrieked to your opposite passenger seat, "its says here that there's a group called the Death Eaters led by a Lord Voldemort who promises a world free of mudbloods or blood traitors!! Wouldn't that be great!!"

You looked at the poster wearily, and didn't like the shifty look on the man's face.

"Yeah... um that's great!!" you say, unwilling to draw her wrath. Not when you'd likely be in her house with her as a prefect. In fact, all the Blacks had been sorted into Slytherin, and you were expected to be sorted there as well.

All your life, mother had told you all sorts of things of how mudbloods were 'creatures of dirt.' You'd never seen one before, but at least you tried to pretend to agree with what your family said.

Just then, your other older sister, Narcissa, came skipping into the room, absolutely beaming.

"You'll never guess what happened!!" she chittered. You rolled your eyes. "What?" you muttered.

"Lucius asked me out on a date!!" she squealed, swooning onto the seat next to Bellatrix. Your eldest sister began teasing her in that other language girls used, it pierced the ears.

So, you thought, the same thing was happening to Narcissa. You had hated it when Bellatrix had brought over that Lestrange jerk into your house last summer, He'd picked on you mercilessly and made you sleep outside while he used your room to do who knows what with her.

That's what the evil @#$! deserves...

You were left fuming the rest of the way to the castle. Finally the train skidded to a stop, and you exited along with the other first years.

You looked toward the side, and noticed Narcissa leaning indolently against a boy. Just as you suspected, he seemed the exact same sort that Lestrange guy had been. You hissed at her, and took a seat on a boat next to a thin boy with unkept black hair.

For a while, neither you, nor the boy next to you said a word.

Finally, the boy spoke up.

"Um, you excited about going to Hogwarts?" he asked somewhat nervously. You sighed, "Not really, all my family has been Slytherins, and they're expecting me to be the same" you cry.

"Oh..." he replies blankly. He shuts his eyes tightly, as if debating whether talking with you might infect him.

"So, what's your name then?" he wonders.

"Black," you reply, "Sirius Black."

The boy bites his teeth, before forcing a smile. "Well, nice to meet you then Sirius, my names James Potter" he replies, holding out a hand.

A shot of alarm banged against your head, the Potter's were one of those wizarding families mother had described as 'blood traitors'. Yet he didn't seem so bad, and what did they know anyways? You weren't slaves to their will like Regulus was!! But you couldn't imagine what would happen if your sisters wrote to mom, telling her that you'd been interloping with the 'wrong sort'!!

A wave of doubt spread over you, should you shake his hand?
12.title: The Blacks

121.content:
"I can't...", you mutter through your teeth, nudging your head toward your sisters, "But my name is Sirius Black...", you say, noticing your sisters turned away. "I can talk later, once we're away from shore."

"Oh...wh-"

"Ssshh...", you say, gesturing toward Beelatrix, who was looking at you strangely.

"I don't know why you care...", he says, "they don't seem to value you much...", now looking at Narcissa, who was making a rude hand gesture in your direction.

"You got that right, but I'll have to spend the summer with them...and I don't want more trouble."

"If you keep on living in their grip you'll never live at all."

You sigh,"Well, it looks like they've already caught on, so the damage is already done..."

You take his hand, and say "Hi! Hope your in my house, James!"

Raising his hand as though offering an imaginary toast, "Let's hope it's not Slytherin!"

You laugh at the expression on your sisters face's and feel a weight lift off your chest. You turn to James, smile, and begin the boat ride across the lake.
121.title: Why do you care?

1211.content:
From then on, your sisters kept a close eye on you, making sure you would not speak to James. That didn't stop you however, and merely ignored them out of defiance. It helped that they were not in the same boat as you, and as he said, you shouldn't live under their grip.

It was a let down once you had to get out of the boat and go your separate ways, but you strode into the great hall feeling more content than your sisters felt you should have. Even as you sat down with the other first years, you felt their piercing gazes tear through you.

One look at those of the Slytherin house was all you needed to conclude that James had a point to hope he wouldn't get sorted there. They all had shifty eyes like those of that self-styled Lord Voldemort fellow from the poster Bellatrix had shown you. Or in otherwords, they seemed just plain mean.

You didn't have to wait long to find out, because there was only one 'A' before you.

"Sirius Black!!" bellowed a balding, pot-bellied man. You stepped forward and sat utop the stool, feeling a old patched hat decend upon your head.

Hmmm, another Black eh? the hat muttered.

"Please, I don't want to be like my sisters" you whisper softly.

You don't want to be in Slytherin? You could be great there you know, it's in your blood! the hat whispered, yet somewhat surprised.

"That's the problem" you reply.

You bring up an excellent point, so better be...
1211.title: Sorting difficulties

12111.content:
"GRYFFINDOR!!" the hat yelled at the top of it's lungs.

Thoroughly surprised that of all wizarding families, a Black would not get sorted Slytherin, the Gryffindor table launched a hearty cheer. You strutted to your table and glanced over at the Slytherin table. The seething look of extreme hatred that contorted your sisters' already hideous face's was priceless. On the other hand, James was all but whooping in glee, pumping his fist.

It took quite a while for the hoopla to calm down, when the sorting continued. You cheered along with the other Gryffindors when a first year would be sorted into your house. So far, you had cheered Alice Chambers, Lily Evans, Frank Longbottom, this extremely pale Remus Lupin kid who somehow reminded you of a werewolf, followed by the rat-faced kid Peter Pettigrew, but you had cheered the loudest when James got sorted into Gryffindor.

"Nice going!! I knew you'd get sorted into Gryffindor!!" you congratulated once he had taken a seat next to you. You weren't listening to who else was being sorted, with the exception of a greacy haired boy named Snape who looked as if he'd spent his holiday with dementors. He should live in my house, they're almost as bad...

Once all the kids were sorted, the feast began, which you spent nearly the entire time speaking with James. You were quickly becoming fast friends, and with him at your side, it'd be much easier to endure the howler that would surely come from mom when she found out.

She can scream as much as she wants, I'm proud to be a Gryffindor!!
12111.title: Against family tradition

choices: She slaps you but then pulls you close and tells you she loves you.

Sure enough, the very next morning a red envelope landed on your desk. You laughed and opened it without a hesitation.

You may NOT return home after this year, or the next, or the next. Stains of dishonour, filthy half-breeds, blood traitors, children of filth! YOU are one of them. You are dead to me."
Your sisters give you evil looks, but you just smile,
"Come over here!" Narcissa yells.

I get up from the table and walk over. Past the Hufflepuff table, then the Ravenclaw, staring at my sister the whole way.

I stop right at her feet. She hits me straight across the face. Then she leans forward whispers into my ear. Hissing, making it seem to the others that she's whispering an insult, but instead I hear:

"What did she say?", James leans forward and inquires curiously.

"She said I'm a slug, and always will be."

After the breakfast of eggs and toast we get up and make our way to the first lesson on our schedual.

13.content:
Before the term


You lay in your bed, moaning as the healer checked your bite.

"Is there anything you can do for poor Remus?" your mother wailed, clutching father while tears sprang from your eyes.

The healer lowered his head, shaking it. "No, the bite is deep, and unfortunately he has now become as much of a werewolf as the one who bit him" he said.

Mother erupted into a fountain of tears, as if you were laying on your death bed. You checked yourself on the far mirror, you didn't look any different than you had before, except for the fact your eyes held a strange, yellowish glint nowadays.

You leaned over to her, "It's okay mom, it's not that bad" you tried to assure, though inside you were just as scared as her. You felt tears stream down your cheek. Why me? you thought. All you had done was play outside a bit longer than usual, just bad luck.

"Doctor, will he be able to go to Hogwarts this coming this fall?" dad shook, the first time you'd ever seen him scared.

"I am not sure Mr. Lupin, but I know that the new Headmaster, Albus Dumbledore, is sympathetic to those with disabilities, and he's a nice man" the doctor tries to assure. "In fact he was once my charms teacher, so you can trust my word" he finishes.

"So...I can still go to school?" you cry hopefully, trembling. Father nods, smiling. "B-but, what if I bite somebody? Everyone will hate me!!" you wail.

"No, it will be just fine" mother says soothingly. You smiled, even if you were a werewolf now, mom and dad still loved you, which was all that mattered. Maybe, if this Dumbledore was as nice as the doctor said he was, maybe Hogwarts won't be so bad after all.

1311.title: Sorting

13111.content:
The feast ended with a flourish; Remus was really liking Hogwarts so far, as everyone there was so odd already. So what if he were a werewolf?

The next moment, a tall lanky teenager with red hair, with a 'P' on his chest approached the Gryffindor 1st years.

"Greetings everyone, my name is Arthur Weasley and I will be escorting you all up to the Gryffindor Commons, if you would follow me" he said. Remus and his fellow first years did; he seemed friendly enough.

Remus was immediately entranced by the moving staircases and the talking pictures. His father had told him of how wonderous a place Hogwarts was, but it was entirely different seeing it in person. He was walking up the staircase when one of the steps dissappeared under him, causing him to trip over and fall. Laughs echoed through the hall.

"You're going to want to watch for the trick steps, you'll do well to memorize them," said Arthur, also sounding somewhat amused. "Though they do tend to change unexpectedly however" he finished. Remus shrugged and got back on his feet.

Before long, they reached a portrait of a Fat Lady. "Password?" she cried.

"Lapis Illuminati" said Arthur, and the next moment, the portrait swung open to allow the 1st years through. When Remus ascended the staircase to the dormitory, he found all his stuff had already been taken up. James immediately sprawled himself onto bed, "I can't wait until the term starts!! I'm really looking forward to Defense Against the Dark Arts!!"

Remus fancied himself a smile, it was a miracle that he even had the chance to come to Hogwarts. "I heard Slughorn's a good teacher, though my father proclaims that he is a traitor to the Slytherin house" said Sirius. James let out a chuckle, "And what does that make you Sirius?"

Sirius rolled his eyes, "Well, my mum and dad are going to be quite displeased to learn I ended up in Gryffindor," said Sirius, his voice containing a large measure of cynicism.

"I'd say" replied Remus, "My father told me every member of the Black family has been Slytherins ever since Hogwarts was founded."

Sirius gave Remus a sardonic looks, before bursting out laughing.

"To be honest with you," said short, mousy Peter, "I'd have rather gone into Slytherin."

Sirius gave out a snort, "And I also bet you that half the Slytherins that were sorted wish they were in Gryffindor, though I probably wouldn't be able to say that about Severus and Lucius, my father introduced me to them when I was little, I don't say I really like them"

"You mean that greacy looking wretch and that pale kid?" cried Remus. "Yeah," bellowed Sirius, "Narcissa absolutely fawns over Lucius, it's absolutely sickening, and Severus, who knows what's going through that kids mind?"

"Quite nice people you've gotten to know" uttered James, "I only hope your roomates are not quite as unpleasant"

That was something Remus had to agree with. With that he went to sleep. The next morning...
13111.title: Gryffindor dorms

133.content:
You stood before a tall man with a long, flowing crimson beard, and half moon spectacles. Naturally you didn't like his glasses, since it reminded you of your horrible symptom.

"So, you must be Remus Lupin correct?" he says.

You nod softly. "And that you are a werewolf am I right?" he continued. His interrogating was distressing, not because it was loud but it possessed something that seemed to pierce thoughts.

You nodded, tears coming down your eyes. He stared at you pityingly.

"You will be pleased to know that special arrangements have been made so you may attend Hogwarts." he said, trying to give you a smile.

"But, what if I bite somebody?" you sob. "You will not have to face this fear, before every full moon, I shall take you to a special place where you will not harm anybody. But do not tell anybody of your condition understand Remus?" Dumbledore finished.

You nodded, "I'll try..."

Dumbledore smiled, "Now, off you go Remus, you do not wish to miss the sorting ceremony do you?" he said.

You exited the office and headed downstairs to the great hall. Before, you would have given anything to be with so many people, but now it was the exact opposite. Even if Dumbledore assured you otherwise, you still held doubts. What if they found out what you were? What if you bit someone? You were a werewolf, and nothing could change that.

info.brief_description: Attend Hogwarts as Harry's parents, Black, Lupin and even Snape if you so wish...
info.description:
Welcome to the Hogwarts of the past, here you can live out the school experiences of James Potter, Lily Evans, Sirius Black, Remus Lupin or Severus Snape. At this time, a young firebrand who goes by the self-styled nickname, 'Lord Voldemort' is recruiting members to join his Death Eaters. Yet school goes on as usual in this Hogwarts of 30 or so years before the present. Their decisions will greatly impact what is in store for the next generation of wizards.

James Potter:

Father of the boy who lived, James is much like his son, in that he is highly skilled in Quiddich, has a knack for breaking school rules, stands for justice, and an expert at practical magic use. He is generally well liked by his fellow Gryffindors, and is seen as a leader. That is, everyone except Lily Evans whom he loathes.

Sirius Black:

James' partner in crime is a loyal friend whom would give his life for him. The first in his family ever to be sorted into Gryffindor, he is constantly at odds with his sisters, Bellatrix and Narcissa, and the rest of his family, all of whom were Slytherins. He views himself as different however, though he does possess a mean streak.

Remus Lupin:

For a while, it seemed like this shy, introverted boy would be unable to attend Hogwarts because of his 'illness', yet Dumbledore, recently appointed as the Headmaster of Hogwarts, made special arrangements for him. Nonetheless, he is afraid that others will find out whom he really is, and naturally avoids others. It could also be the fact he is picked on mercillessly by Slytherins, most notoriously Lucius Malfoy and his gang.

Lily Evans:

She had been pleasantly surprised upon receiving an invitation to attend Hogwarts, but quickly made up for lost time with steady reading. Not surprisingly, she has a high affinity for academics, and is a stickler for rules. She absolutely abhors the antics of James and his band of hooligans.

Severus Snape:

Even as a boy, the young Snape already possessed an alarming knowledge of the dark arts and a mad lust for potion making. It is all 'that creepy kid with the greacy hair' does in his spare time, at least when he isn't spying on James' gang, whom he claims are trying to take over the school. Not even Slytherins would dare speak with him, for Snape sees enemies everywhere. Who knows what goes on inside his greacy head?
